Entries.default: As you follow the winding streets of Neketaka, the usual city sounds of cart wheels against cobbles and shouting vendors fades, replaced by the cacophony of a heated argument on the verge of boiling over.

"Captain?" The unfamiliar sailor chuckles, her eyes heavily hooded. 


"You should've taught your mates not to start fights they don't have the stones to finish."

Her compatriots snicker, shifting towards you.
"I'm sorry about my mate's behavior, but I can't let you make them unfit to serve. I donâ€™t suppose an apology would suffice?"
"If you don't know who I am already, you will soon. You do not want to cross me."
[Attack] "Nobody messes with [Player Ship]. Prepare to answer for it."
[Leave] "Seems to me [Specified 0]'s getting what they've earned."
As you walk away, you hear [Specified 0]'s terrified shrieks and the sounds of fists and boots on flesh.

As the sailors draw their weapons and turn towards you, [Specified 0] shouts thanks and takes off full-speed towards the docks.

The sailors advance.

The sailors turn to you as one, eyes roving you as they size you up. One of them raises an open gloved hand, her palm towards you.

"There's no need for bloodshed. Take your mate, and we'll go our own way." She looks at [Specified 0]. "Pray you do not cross us again."

She turns on her heel and strides away, followed by the other sailors.

The sailors look to one another, and one nods. She looks to [Specified 0]. "Let's hear it."

[Specified 0] gives you a sad glance, then looks back to the woman. "Sorry, ma'am."

"What was that?" The other sailors snicker.

"Sorry, ma'am!"

The woman salutes you, then turns on her heel. The sailors walk away.

"Captain?" The unfamiliar sailor scowls as she looks you over. 

"You a cheater like your sailor here? Way I see it, [Specified 0] owes us coin. Brought weighted dice to our friendly game." 

Her compatriots nod, shifting towards you.

"Captain?" The unfamiliar sailor scowls as she looks you over. 

"You should teach your sailors better manners. This sodden fool got sick all over our boots." 

Her compatriots nod, eyes searching you.
[Approach the commotion.]
[Leave.]

As you round the corner, you see [Specified 0] surrounded by a group of unfamiliar soldiers. From their dress, you don't believe they're locals. They shout at [Specified 0], who returns the yelling with interest, though you can't make out the actual matter of the argument. 

One of the sailors shoves [Specified 0] against a wall, and the hand of another thug lingers dangerously near his weapon.
[Shift into your spirit form.]
"Perhaps a few coins will clear this all up?"

One of the sailors takes the purse you offer, weighing it in her gloved hand.

"Aye, friend. This about evens things between us and your mate."

The sailors walk away, leaving you with [Specified 0].
One of the voices rings familiar. [Specified 0] from [Player Ship].
[Fire an arrow at one of the unfamiliar toughs with your bow.]
[Sneak closer to observe.]

As you round the corner, you see [Specified 0] surrounded by a group of unfamiliar soldiers. From their dress, you don't believe they're locals. They shout at [Specified 0], who returns the yelling with interest, though you can't make out the actual matter of the argument. 

One of the sailors shoves [Specified 0] against a wall, and the hand of another thug lingers dangerously near his weapon.
[Draw your weapons and attack.]
[Approach openly.]
As the sailors shove a shouting [Specified 0] into an alley, you move into position to attack...

[Specified 0]'s eyes meet yours and widen. 

"Captain! Thank the gods! I could use a hand here!"

You let loose an arrow that buries itself deeply into a sailor's shoulder. He stumbles back, his hand covering the wound. Blood oozes between his fingers in scarlet pulses.

The other sailors take a step away from you as they look you over. After whispering to one another, the sailors turn and flee down the street.

Your arrow sails through the group and past, lodging itself into a barrel. Several sets of eyes turn towards you. 

"That idiot tried to shoot us!" The unfamiliar sailor checks himself over as if making sure you didn't hit him with any arrows he didn't notice.

Another of the sailors straightens and points a slender finger at you. "You've signed your own death warrant!"

Her compatriots nod, drawing weapons as they approach.

One of the sailors takes the purse you offer, weighing it in her gloved hand.

"Aye, friend. This about evens things between us and your mate."

The sailors walk away, leaving you with [Specified 0].

Silence hangs on the air for a moment as the sailors seem to consider your words.

As one they begin laughing, and [Specified 0] begins to slink away.

One of them draws her weapon and points it at you. "Let's teach the captain here a lesson."

They advance.

Without saying a word, you call on the spiritual essence around you. Your muscles crack and bones pop as you grow taller. Thick fur grows carpets you, and sharp claws jut from your hands.

The sailors stare at you in abject terror, each taking hesitant steps from you. As you howl, one of them shouts and the group breaks and flees down the street.

The magic flees you, and you revert to your usual shape.

[Specified 0] approaches you, grinning openly.

"Thanks, captain! You truly saved me just now."
"Return to [Player Ship], sailor."
"Cause me trouble again, and it'll be me you're cringing from. Get out of my sight."
"Be more careful. Next time I might not be there to save you."

"Yes, captain!"

[Specified 0] heads off towards the ship, whistling along the way.
The color drains from [Specified 0]'s face. A hurried nod later, the sailor bolts in the direction of the docks.
"The captain speaks true, friend. Best turn round and walk away." Serafen's hand rests upon the handle of his weapon.
"A perfectly reasonable way to resolve matters." Aloth looks brightly between the aggrieved parties.
"You'll take those coins if you know what's good for you." Xoti draws an invisible line across her throat with the point of her sickle.
"Perhaps a few coins will clear this all up?"
"You'll take those coins if you know what's good for you." Xoti draws an invisible line across her throat with the point of her sickle.

The sailors turn to you as one, eyes roving you as they size you up. One of them raises an open gloved hand, her palm towards you.

"There's no need for bloodshed. Take your mate, and we'll go our own way." She looks at [Specified 0]. "Pray you do not cross us again."

She turns on her heel and strides away, followed by the other sailors.

You let loose an arrow that buries itself deeply into a sailor's shoulder. He stumbles back, his hand covering the wound. Blood oozes between his fingers in scarlet pulses.

The other sailors take a step away from you as they look you over. After whispering to one another, the sailors turn and flee down the street.
